GENERAL PROVISIONS
§ 71.01 COMMERCIAL VEHICLES IN RESIDENTIAL ZONES.
   No truck, van, bus, trailer or other commercial vehicle in excess of 8,000
pounds registered vehicle weight shall be permitted in any residential zone or
the residential areas of the Township Center or General Business 2 Zone except
for the purpose of picking up or making deliveries in the regular course of
business within such residential zone or for the purpose of installing,
maintaining or otherwise performing public utility service. Signs specifically
prohibiting such vehicles on the streets designated in Chapter 74, Schedule
XIII have been approved by the New Jersey Department of Transportation.
§ 71.02 USE OF CLEAT-TYPE VEHICLES PROHIBITED.
   No cleat-type motor vehicle or construction equipment shall be permitted to
be operated or used on any municipal street in the Township.
(Ord. 929-99, passed 4-12-99)
('74 Code, § 122-10.1) (Ord. 407-1988, passed 5-23-88; Am. Ord. 502-1990,
passed 7-9-90)
Penalty, see § 70.99
§ 71.03 BICYCLE PATHS.
   (A)   (1)   The Township has striped a five-foot wide bicycle lane on the
existing pavement with traffic control signage on Centennial Boulevard in both
directions; and
      (2)   The lane designation begins at Old Egg Harbor Road and ends
approximately 1,500 feet south of Kresson Road (C.R. 671) where the lane
striping ends; and
      (3)   The bicycle route is designated as “share the road” with
appropriate signage from this point to the Kresson Road intersection; where it
heads southeast on Kresson Road 100 feet; and
      (4)   The bicycle route lane striping begins on Kresson Road,
approximately 100 feet southeast of Centennial Boulevard. The lane is
delineated with striping on each side of the five-foot wide lane and related
traffic control signage. This lane continues to Gibbsboro Road where the
bicycle route temporarily ends; and
      (5)   The bicycle route begins on Dutchtown Road with “share the road”
designation 1,000 feet west of State Highway Route 73. The designated route
continues for approximately one mile along Dutchtown Road until it heads west
along Regency Drive, west on Woodbrook Road, south on Cooper Road and finally
west on Victor Boulevard. The entire portion of the shared use bicycle route
has related traffic control signs notifying motorists that the lane is intended
for shared use with bicyclists; and
      (6)   The five-foot wide, striped bicycle lane begins at the beginning of
Victor Boulevard and is in both directions on Victor Boulevard. The bicycle
route terminates at Berlin Road (C.R. 561); and
      (7)   The bicycle route has been constructed in accordance with NJDOT
(New Jersey Department of Transportation) and AASHTO (American Association of
State Highway and Transportation Officials) design standards and guidelines.
   (B)   (1)   The Township has created a five-foot wide bicycle lane on the
existing pavement with traffic control signage on Cooper Road in both
directions; and
      (2)   The lane designation begins at the intersection of Centennial
Boulevard and ends approximately at the township line with the Township of
Berlin where the lane striping ends; and
      (3)   The bicycle route shall be designated as "share the road" with
appropriate signage from this point; and
      (4)   The bicycle route has been constructed in accordance with NJDOT
(New Jersey Department of Transportation) and AASHTO (American Association of
State highway and Transportation Officials) design standards and guidelines.
(Ord. 32-03, passed 9-9-03; Am. Ord. 77-06, passed 2-13-06)
TRAFFIC AND PARKING REGULATIONS FOR SPECIFIC LOCATIONS
§ 71.10 MAIN STREET COMPLEX.
   (A)   Parking. All vehicles must park only in the designated areas and
between the lines provided.
('74 Code, § 122-30.13)
   (B)   No stopping or standing. No person shall stop or stand a vehicle on
any roadway at the Main Street Complex.
('74 Code, § 122-30.14)
   (C)   Handicapped parking. All stalls shall be 12 feet wide as shown on the
site plan attached to Ord. 507-1990 and signed with R7-8 (reserved parking sign
and penalty plate) in the designated parking areas for persons who have been
issued the handicapped parking permits by the Division of Motor Vehicles (as
shown on the site plan).
('74 Code, § 122-30.15)
   (D)   Stop intersections. The following streets or parts of streets are
hereby designated as stop intersections:
      (1)   All intersections as shown on the site plan, stop sign on near
right side of each street; and
      (2)   Intersection of Roads D and E, stop sign on near right side of each
road at intersection.
('74 Code, § 122-30.16)
   (E)   One-way streets. The following described streets or parts of streets
are hereby designated as one-way streets in the direction indicated (as shown
on the site plan attached to Ord. 507-1990).
('74 Code, § 122-30.17)
   (F)   Lane use. The following intersections are hereby designated as lane
use reservations (as shown on the attached site plan).
('74 Code, § 122-30.18)
   (G)   Speed limits.
      (1)   The speed limits for both directions of traffic in the parking lots
and interior roadways shall be 15 miles per hour.
      (2)   The speed limit for both directions of travel on all exterior
roadways is 25 miles per hour.
      (3)   Regulatory and warning signs shall be erected and maintained to
effect the above designated speed limits authorized by the Department of
Transportation.
('74 Code, § 122-30.19)
   (H)   Tow-away zones. Any vehicle parked or standing as to obstruct or
impede a normal flow of traffic, block entrances or exitways, loading zones,
oil fills, any grass area or pedestrian walkway or present in any way a safety
or traffic hazard may be removed by towing the vehicle at the owner's or
operator's expense.
('74 Code, § 122-30.20)
   (I)   Installation of signs. All signs, posts, bolts or other necessary
materials shall be installed and paid for by the Police Department to ensure
installations meet state and federal specifications, and all signing shall
conform to the current Manual on Uniform Traffic Control Devices.
('74 Code, § 122-30.21)
   (J)   Violations and penalties. Unless another penalty is expressly provided
by state statute, every person convicted of a violation of this section or any
supplement thereto shall be subject to penalty in accordance with the schedule
of penalties adopted for such violation. For violations for which no penalty
has previously been prescribed, the penalty shall be as set forth in §
70.99. ('74 Code, § 122-30.22)
(Ord. 507-1990, passed 7-23-90; Am. Ord. 839-97, passed 10-13-97; Am. Ord. 853-
97, passed 12-8-97: AM./ Ord. 963-99, passed 11-22-99)
Editor's note:
   The Main Street Complex site plan is on file in the Township offices
§ 71.11 THE CORNERS APARTMENTS.
   (A)   Parking. All vehicles must park only in the designated areas and
between the lines provided.
('74 Code, § 122-30.24)
   (B)   No stopping or standing. No person shall stop or stand a vehicle on
any roadway at the Corners Apartments.
('74 Code, § 122-30.25)
   (C)   Handicapped parking. All stalls shall be 12 feet wide as shown on the
site plan attached to Ord. 508-1990 and signed with R7-8 (reserved parking sign
and penalty plate) in the designated parking areas for persons who have been
issued the handicapped parking permits by the Division of Motor Vehicles (as
shown on the site plan).
('74 Code, § 122-30.26)
   (D)   Stop intersections. The following streets or parts of streets are
hereby designated as stop intersections. Stop signs shall be installed on the
near right side of each street intersecting the stop intersection (as shown on
the site plan attached to Ord. 508-1990).
('74 Code, § 122-30.27)
   (E)   One-way streets. The following described streets or parts of streets
are hereby designated as one-way streets in the direction indicated (as shown
on the site plan attached to Ord. 508-1990).
('74 Code, § 122-30.28)
   (F)   Lane use. The following intersections are hereby designated as lane
use reservations (as shown on the attached site plan). ('74 Code, § 122-30.29)
   (G)   Speed limits.
      (1)   The speed limits for both directions of traffic in the parking lots
and interior roadways shall be 15 miles per hour.
      (2)   The speed limit for both directions of travel on all exterior
roadways is 25 miles per hour.
      (3)   Regulatory and warning signs shall be erected and maintained to
effect the above designated speed limits authorized by the Department of
Transportation.
('74 Code, § 122-30.30)
   (H)   Tow-away zones. Any vehicle parked or standing as to obstruct or
impede a normal flow of traffic, block entrances or exitways, loading zones,
oil fills, any grass area or pedestrian walkway or present in any way a safety
or traffic hazard may be removed by towing the vehicle at the owner's or
operator's expense.
('74 Code, § 122-30.31)
   (I)   Installation of signs. All signs, posts, bolts or other necessary
materials shall be installed and paid for by the Police Department to ensure
installations meet state and federal specifications, and all signing shall
conform to the current Manual on Uniform Traffic Control Devices.
('74 Code, § 122-30.32)
   (J)   Violations and penalties. Unless another penalty is expressly provided
by state statute, every person convicted of a violation of this section or any
supplement thereto shall be subject to penalty in accordance with the schedule
of penalties adopted for such violation. For violations for which no penalty
has previously been prescribed, the penalty shall be as set forth in §
70.99.
('74 Code, § 122-30.33)
(Ord. 508-1990, passed 7-23-90; Am. Ord. 853-97, passed 12-8-97)
Editor's note:
   The Corners Apartments site plan is on file in the Township offices

shall be placed on Road A.

placed on Road B.

sign shall be placed on Road C (both intersects).
('74 Code, § 122-30.116)

(s) shall be 15 miles per hour.

roads are: 15 miles per hour on the entire length of all roadways.

§ 71.20 VICTORIANA CONDOMINIUMS.
   (A)   Parking.
      (1)   All vehicles must park only in designated areas and between the
lines provided.
      (2)   Handicapped parking. All stalls shall be 12 feet wide as shown on
the attached site plan and signed with R7-8 and R7-8P (reserved parking sign
and penalty plate) in the designated parking areas for persons who have been
issued the handicapped parking permits by the Division of Motor Vehicles.
('74 Code, § 122-30.122)
   (B)   Stop intersections. The following described intersections are hereby
designated as stop intersections. Step signs shall be installed as provided
therein:
      (1)   At the intersection of Gregory's Way and Buttonwood Drive, a stop
sign shall be placed on Gregory's Way.
      (2)   At the intersection of Gregory's Way and Kirkbride Road, a stop
sign shall be placed on Gregory's Way.
      (3)   At the intersection of Roberts Way and Kirkbride Road, a stop sign
shall be placed on Roberts Way.
      (4)   At the intersection of Sandra Road and Kirkbride Road, a stop sign
shall be placed on Sandra Road.
      (5)   At the intersection of Roberts Way and Sandra Road, a stop sign
shall be placed on Roberts Way.
('74 Code, § 122-30.123)
   (C)   Speed limits.
      (1)   The speed limit for both directions of traffic in the parking lot
(s) shall be 15 miles per hour.
      (2)   The speed limit for both directions of travel on the entire length
of the following roadways are:
         (a)   Kirkbride Road, 25 mph.
         (b)   Sandra Road, 25 mph.
         (c)   Gregory's Way, 15 mph.
         (d)   Roberts Way, 15 mph.
      (3)   Regulatory and warning signs shall be erected and maintained to
effect the above-designated speed limits authorized by the Department of
Transportation.
('74 Code, § 122-30.124)
   (D)   Tow-away zone. Any vehicle parked or standing as to obstruct or impede
a normal flow of traffic, block entrances or exitways, loading zones, oil
fills, any grass-area, pedestrian walkway or present in any way a safety or
traffic hazard may be removed by towing the vehicle at the owner's or
operator's expense.
('74 Code, § 122-30.125)
   (E)   Violations and penalties. Unless another penalty is expressly provided
by state statute, every person convicted of a violation of this section or any
supplement thereto shall be subject to a penalty in accordance with the
schedule of penalties adopted for such violation. For violations for which no
penalty has previously been prescribed, the penalty shall be as set forth in §
70.99.
('74 Code, § 122-30.126)
(Ord. 757-96, passed 3-11-96; Am. Ord. 853-97, passed 12-8-97; Am. Ord. 963-99,
passed 11-22-99 )
Editor's note:
   The Victoriana Condominiums site plan is on file in the Township office.

Transportation.
('74 Code, § 122-30.129)
   (D)   Tow-away zones. Any vehicles parked or standing as to obstruct or
impede a normal flow of traffic, block entrances or exit ways, loading zones,
oil fills, any grassy area, pedestrian walkway, or present in any way a safety
or traffic hazard may be removed by towing the vehicle at the owner's or
operator's expense.
('74 Code, § 122-30.130)
   (E)   Installation of signs. All signs, posts or other necessary materials
shall be installed and paid for by the applicant. All signing shall conform to
the current Manual on Uniform Traffic Control Devices, pursuant to N.J.S.A. 39:
4-198 and N.J.S.A 39:4-183.27.
('74 Code, § 122-30.131)
   (F)   Violations and penalties. Unless another penalty is expressly provided
by state statute, every person convicted of a violation of this section or any
supplement thereto shall be subject to a penalty as provided in §
70.99.
('74 Code, § 122-30.132)
(Ord. 835-97, passed 10-13-97; Am. Ord. 853-97, passed 12-8-97)
Editor's note:
   The Adams Place Office Complex Phase One site plan is on file in the
Township Clerk's office.
§ 71.22 RITZ THEATRE COMPLEX.
   (A)   Parking.
      (1)   All vehicles must park in designated areas and between the lines
provided.
      (2)   No person shall stop or stand a vehicle upon any of the streets or
parts of streets described as follows: the Ritz Theatre, entire perimeter of
the building.
      (3)   Handicapped parking. All stalls shall be 12 feet wide as shown on
the attached site plan, and will be marked with signage pursuant to R7-8 and
R7-8P (Reserved Parking Sign and Penalty Plate), in the designated parking
areas for persons who have been issued the handicapped parking permits by the
Division of Motor Vehicles.
('74 Code, § 122-30.156)
   (B)   Stop intersections. Pursuant to the provisions of N.J.S.A. 39:4-140,
all areas shown on the attached site plan as stop intersections are hereby
designated as stop intersections. Stop signs shall be installed as provided in
N.J.S.A. 39:4-140.
('74 Code, § 122-30.157)
   (C)   Speed limits.
      (1)   The speed limits for both directions of traffic for the parking lot
areas shall be 15 miles per hour.
      (2)   Regulatory and warning signs shall be erected and maintained to
effect the above-designated speed limits authorized by the Department of
Transportation.
('74 Code, § 122-30.158)
   (D)   Tow-away zones. Any vehicles parked or standing as to obstruct or
impede a normal flow of traffic, block entrances or exit ways, loading zones,
oil fills, any grassy area, pedestrian walkway, or present in any way a safety
or traffic hazard may be removed by towing the vehicle at the owner's or
operator's expense.
('74 Code, § 122-30.159)
   (E)   Installation of signs. All signs, posts or other necessary materials
shall be installed and paid for by the applicant. All signing shall conform to
the current Manual on Uniform Traffic Control Devices, pursuant to N.J.S.A. 39:
4-198 and N.J.S.A 39:4-183.27.
('74 Code, § 122-30.160)
   (F)   Violations and penalties. Unless another penalty is expressly provided
by state statute, every person convicted of a violation of this section or any
supplement thereto shall be subject to a penalty as provided in §
70.99.
('74 Code, § 122-30.161)
(Ord. 837-97, passed 10-13-97; Am. Ord. 853-97, passed 12-8-97)

   The Ritz Theatre site plan is on file in the Township Clerk's office.
§ 71.23 WEST JERSEY HEALTH SYSTEMS (VOORHEES CAMPUS).
   (A)   Parking.
      (1)   All vehicles must park in designated areas and between the lines
provided.
      (2)   No person shall stop or stand a vehicle upon any of the streets or
parts of streets described as follows: all roads, both sides, all hours, for
the entire length.
      (3)   Handicapped parking. All stalls shall be 12 feet wide as shown on
the attached site plan, and will be marked with signage pursuant to R7-8 and
R7-8P (Reserved Parking Sign and Penalty Plate), in the designated parking
areas for persons who have been issued the handicapped parking permits by the
Division of Motor Vehicles.
('74 Code, § 122-30.134)
   (B)   Reserved parking. Only those vehicles that are granted specialty
parking in this section (such as police vehicles, ambulances, teachers, and the
like, which must be properly identified) are permitted to park in Reserved
Parking areas as shown on the attached site plan.
('74 Code § 122-30.135)
   (C)   Through streets. The following streets or parts of streets are hereby
designated as through streets. Stop signs shall be installed on the near right
side of each street intersecting the through street, except where yield signs
are provided for in the designation.
      (1)   Carnie Boulevard, entire length;
      (2)   Mohrfeld Drive, entire length;
      (3)   Road A, entire length; and
      (4)   Road B, entire length.
('74 Code § 122-30.136)
   (D)   One-way streets. The following described streets or parts of streets
are hereby designated as one-way streets, in the direction indicated:
      (1)   Road F, North, entire length;
      (2)   Road G, North, entire length;
      (3)   Road H, North, entire length;
      (4)   Road I, South, entire length; and
      (5)   Road L, North, entire length.
('74 Code § 122-30.137)
   (E)   Speed limits.
      (1)   The speed limits for both directions of traffic for the parking lot
areas shall be 15 miles per hour.
      (2)   The speed limit for both directions of travel on the following
roadways are as follows:
         (a)   Carnie Boulevard, 20 m.p.h., entire length;
         (b)   Mohrfeld Drive, 20 m.p.h., entire length; and
         (c)   Roads A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J, K, and L, 15 m.p.h., entire
length.
      (2)   Regulatory and warning signs shall be erected and maintained to
effect the above-designated speed limits authorized by the Department of
Transportation.
('74 Code, § 122-30.138)
   (F)   Tow-away zones. Any vehicles parked or standing as to obstruct or
impede a normal flow of traffic, block entrances or exit ways, loading zones,
oil fills, any grassy area, pedestrian walkway, or present in any way a safety
or traffic hazard may be removed by towing the vehicle at the owner's or
operator's expense.
('74 Code, § 122-30.139)
   (G)   Loading Zones. The locations described are hereby designated as a
loading zone. No person shall park a vehicle in these locations during the
times indicated other than for the loading or unloading of goods and materials:
      (1)   Road H, all times, East side, as indicated on site plan;
      (2)   Road I, all times, West side, as indicated on site plan;
      (3)   Road G, all times, East side, as indicated on site plan;
      (4)   Various loading docks, all times, as indicated on site plan; and
      (5)   Road J, all times, south side, as indicated on site plan.
('74 Code § 122-30.140)
   (H)   Bus stops. The locations described are hereby designated as bus stops.
No vehicle, other than an omnibus picking up or discharging passengers, shall
be permitted to occupy these locations between the hours indicated: Carnie
Boulevard (southbound) on the westerly side at Road I (far side) beginning at
the southerly curb line of Road I (northerly intersect) and extending southerly
to within 25 feet of the mid-block crosswalk on Carnie Boulevard, all hours.
('74 Code § 122-30.141)
   (I)   Turn prohibitions. No person shall make a turn at any location listed
and only in the manner described: Carnie Boulevard, U-turns prohibited, entire
length.
('74 Code § 122-30.142)
   (J)   Mid-block crosswalks. The following described locations are hereby
designated as mid-block crosswalks:
      (1)   Carnie Boulevard, as indicated on site plan;
      (2)   Road A, as indicated on site plan; and
      (3)   Road J, as indicated on site plan.
('74 Code § 122-30.143)
   (K)   Installation of signs. All signs, posts or other necessary materials
shall be installed and paid for by the applicant. All signing shall conform to
the current Manual on Uniform Traffic Control Devices, pursuant to N.J.S.A. 39:
4-198 and N.J.S.A 39:4-183.27.
('74 Code, § 122-30.144)
   (L)   Violations and penalties. Unless another penalty is expressly provided
by state statute, every person convicted of a violation of this section or any
supplement thereto shall be subject to a penalty as provided in §
70.99.
('74 Code, § 122-30.145)
(Ord. 836-97, passed 10-13-97; Am. Ord. 853-97, passed 12-8-97; Am. Ord. 963-
99, passed 11-22-99)
Editor's note:
   The West Jersey Health Systems (Voorhees Campus) site plan is on file in the
Township Clerk's office.
§ 71.24 EAGLE PLAZA SHOPPING CENTER PHASES ONE AND TWO.
   (A)   Parking.
      (1)   All vehicles must park in designated areas and between the lines
provided.
      (2)   Handicapped parking. All stalls shall be 12 feet wide as shown on

R7-8P (Reserved Parking Sign and Penalty Plate), in the designated parking
areas for persons who have been issued the handicapped parking permits by the
Division of Motor Vehicles.
('74 Code, § 122-30.147)
   (B)   Stop intersections. Pursuant to the provisions of N.J.S.A. 39:4-140,
the intersections described are hereby designated as stop intersection. Stop
signs shall be installed as provided in N.J.S.A. 39:4-140.
      (1)   Main Drive and Center Drive, stop sign on Center Drive;
      (2)   Center Drive and Interior Drive, stop sign on Interior Drive; and
      (3)   Interior Drive and McDonald's Driveway, stop sign on McDonald's
Driveway.
('74 Code § 122-30.148)
   (C)   Speed limits. 
      (1)   The speed limits for both directions of traffic for the parking lot
areas shall be 15 miles per hour.
      (2)   Regulatory and warning signs shall be erected and maintained to
effect the above-designated speed limits authorized by the Department of
Transportation.
('74 Code, § 122-30.149)
   (D)   Lane use reservations. The land locations described are designated as
lane use reservations and traffic shall move only as indicated:
      (1)   The most northerly driveway at Voorhees Drive: eastbound left lane
for left turn only, eastbound right lane for through and right turn only;
      (2)   The most southerly driveway at Voorhees Drive: eastbound left lane
for left turn only, eastbound right lane for through and right turn only; and
      (3)   Main Drive and Center Drive Westbound: Right lane for right turn
only, left lane for left turn only.
('74 Code § 122-30.150)
   (E)   Mid-block crosswalks. The areas designated on the site plan with a
W11A-2 (Crossing Sign) are hereby designed as mid-block crosswalks.
('74 Code § 122-30.151)
   (F)   Tow-away zone. Any vehicles parked or standing as to obstruct or
impede a normal flow of traffic, block entrances or exit ways, loading zones,
oil fills, any grassy area, pedestrian walkway, or present in any way a safety
or traffic hazard may be removed by towing the vehicle at the owner's or
operator's expense.
('74 Code, § 122-30.152)
   (G)   Installation of signs. All signs, posts or other necessary materials
shall be installed and paid for by the applicant. All signing shall conform to
the current Manual on Uniform Traffic Control Devices, pursuant to N.J.S.A. 39:
4-198 and N.J.S.A 39:4-183.27.
('74 Code, § 122-30.153)
   (L)   Violations and penalties. Unless another penalty is expressly provided
by state statute, every person convicted of a violation of this section or any
supplement thereto shall be subject to a penalty as provided in §
70.99.
('74 Code, § 122-30.154)
(Ord. 838-97, passed 10-13-97; Am. Ord. 853-97, passed 12-8-97)

   The Eagle Plaza Shopping Center Phases One and Two site plan is on file in
the Township Clerk's office.

areas for persons who have been issued the handicapped parking permits by the
Division of Motor Vehicles.
('74 Code, § 122-30.166)

parking in this section (such as police vehicles, ambulances, teachers, and the
like, which must be properly identified) are permitted to park in Reserved

('74 Code § 122-30.167)

signs are provided for in the designation.

         (b)   Road B, entire length.

hereby designated as stop intersections. Stop signs shall be installed as
provided herein:
         (a)   Road B and Road D; stop sign at Road D;
         (b)   Road C and Road D; stop sign at Road D;
         (c)   Road E and Aisle #2 (both intersections); stop sign at Aisle #2
(both intersections);
         (d)   Laurel Oak Road and Exit Drive; stop sign at Exit Drive; and
         (e)   Road C and Aisle #2; stop sign at Aisle #2.
      (3)   Yield intersections. The following described intersections are
hereby designated as yield intersections. Yield signs shall be installed as
provided herein: Road A and Entrance Drive; yield sign at Road A.
   (D)   One-way streets. The following described streets or parts of streets
are hereby designated as one-way streets in the direction indicated:
      (1)   Entrance Drive, east, entire length;
      (2)   Road A, east, entire length;
      (3)   Aisle #1, east, entire length;
      (4)   Road B, west (counter-clockwise), entire length;
      (5)   Road C, south, entire length; and
      (6)   Exit Drive, west, entire length.
('74 Code § 122-30.169)
   (E)   Speed limits.  
      (1)   The speed limits for both directions of traffic for the parking lot
areas shall be 15 miles per hour.
      (2)   The speed limit for both directions of travel on the following
roadways are as follows: all roads, 15 miles per hour, entire length.
      (3)   Regulatory and warning signs shall be erected and maintained to
effect the above-designated speed limits authorized by the Department of
Transportation.
('74 Code, § 122-30.170)
   (F)   Tow-away zones. Any vehicles parked or standing as to obstruct or
impede a normal flow of traffic, block entrances or exit ways, loading zones,
oil fills, any grassy area, pedestrian walkway, or present in any way a safety
or traffic hazard may be removed by towing the vehicle at the owner's or
operator's expense.
('74 Code, § 122-30.171)
   (G)   Installation of signs. All signs, posts or other necessary materials
shall be installed and paid for by the applicant. All signing shall conform to
the current Manual on Uniform Traffic Control Devices, pursuant to N.J.S.A. 39:
4-198 and N.J.S.A 39:4-183.27.
('74 Code, § 122-30.172)
   (H)   Violations and penalties. Unless another penalty is expressly provided
by state statute, every person convicted of a violation of this section or any

70.99.
('74 Code, § 122-30.173)

§ 71.26 THE TARGET STORE.
      (A)   Parking.
      (1)   All vehicles must park in designated areas and between the lines
provided.
      (2)   No person shall stop or stand a vehicle upon any of the streets or
parts of streets described as follows: all roads, both sides, all hours, for

      (3)   Handicapped parking. All stalls shall be 12 feet wide as shown on
the attached site plan, and will be marked with signage pursuant to R7-8 and
R7-8P (Reserved Parking Sign and Penalty Plate), in the designated parking
areas for persons who have been issued the handicapped parking permits by the
Division of Motor Vehicles.
   (B)   Through streets, stop intersections.
      (1)   Through streets. The following streets or parts of streets are
hereby designated as through streets. Stop signs shall be installed on the near
right side of each street intersecting the through street, except where yield
signs are provided for in the designation:
         (a)   Road A, entire length; and
         (b)   Road B, entire length.
      (2)   Stop intersections. The following described intersections are
hereby designated as stop intersections. Stop signs shall be installed as
provided herein:
         (a)   Executive Drive and Road B (North intersection); stop sign at
Road B (North intersection); and
         (b)   Executive Drive and Road B (South intersection); stop sign at
Road B (South intersection).
   (C)   Speed limits. 
      (1)   The speed limits for both directions of traffic for the parking lot
areas shall be 15 miles per hour.
      (2)   The speed limit for both directions of travel on the following
roadways are as follows: all roads, 15 miles per hour, entire length.
      (2)   Regulatory and warning signs shall be erected and maintained to
effect the above-designated speed limits authorized by the Department of
Transportation.
   (D)   Tow away zone. Any vehicles parked or standing as to obstruct or
impede a normal flow of traffic, block entrances or exit ways, loading zones,
oil fills, any grassy area, pedestrian walkway, or present in any way a safety
or traffic hazard may be removed by towing the vehicle at the owner's or
operator's expense.
   (E)   Loading Zones. The locations described are hereby designated as a
loading zone. No person shall park a vehicle in these locations during the
times indicated other than for the loading or unloading of goods and materials:
Road B, all times, East side, as indicated on site plan.
   (F)   Turn prohibitions. No person shall make a turn at any location listed
and only in the manner described: White Horse Road (C.R. 673) and Road A, left
turns prohibited, from northbound on Road A to westbound on White Horse Road
(C.R. 673).
   (G)   Installation of signs. All signs, posts or other necessary materials
shall be installed and paid for by the applicant. All signing shall conform to
the current Manual on Uniform Traffic Control Devices, pursuant to N.J.S.A. 39:
4-198 and N.J.S.A 39:4-183.27.
   (H)   Violations and penalties. Unless another penalty is expressly provided
by state statute, every person convicted of a violation of this section or any
supplement thereto shall be subject to a penalty as provided in §
70.99.
(Ord. 877-98, passed 5-26-98; Am. Ord. 857-97, passed 1-26-98)

   The Target Store site plan is on file in the Township Clerk's office.
§ 71.27 THREE PONDS CONDOMINIUM.
   (A)    Parking.
      (1)    All vehicles must park in designated areas and between the lines
provided.
      (2)    No person shall stop or stand a vehicle upon any streets or parts
of streets described as follows: all courts, both sides, all hours, for the
entire length.
      (3)    Handicapped Parking. All stalls shall be 12 foot wide as shown on
the attached site plan and will be marked with signage pursuant to R.7-8 and
R.7-8P (Reserved Parking Signs and Penalty Plate), in the designated parking
areas for persons who have been issued the Handicapped Parking Permit by the
Division of Motor Vehicles.
   (B)    Through streets and stop intersections.
      (1)    Through streets. The following streets or parts of streets are
hereby designated as through streets. Stop signs shall be installed on the near
right side of each street intersection the through street, except where yield
signs are provided for in the designation.
         (a)    Three Ponds Drive, for the entire length.
      (2) Stop intersections. The following described intersections are hereby
designated as stop intersections. Stop signs shall be installed as provided
herein.
         (a)    Three Ponds Drive and Kirkbride Road; stop sign on Three Ponds
Drive.
         (b)    Golden Pond Court and Kirkbride Road; stop sign on Golden Pond
Drive.
   (C)    Speed limits.
      (1)    The speed limit for both directions of travel on all roadways
shall be 15 miles per hour over the entire length of such roadways.
      (2)    Regulatory and warning signs shall be erected and maintained to
effect the above designated speed limits authorized by the Department of
Transportation.
   (D)    Tow away zone. Any vehicles parked or standing so as to obstruct or
impede the normal flow of traffic, block entrances or exitways, loading zones,
oil fills, any grassy area, pedestrian walkway, or present in any way a safety
or traffic hazard may be removed by towing the vehicle at the owner's or
operator's expense.
   (E)    Installation of signs. All signs, posts or other necessary materials
shall be installed and paid for by the applicant. All signage shall conform to
the current manual on Uniform Traffic Control Devices, pursuant to N.J.S.A. 39:
4-198 and N.J.S.A. 39:4-183.27.
   (F)    Violations and penalties. Unless another penalty is expressly
provided by state statute, every person convicted of a violation of this
section or any supplement thereto shall be subject to a penalty as provided in
§
70.99. For violations for which no penalty has previously been prescribed, the
penalty shall not be more than $50 or imprisonment for a term not to exceed 15
days, or both.
(Ord. 920-99, passed 4-12-99)
Editor's note:
   The Three Ponds Condominium site plan is on file in the Township Clerk's
office.
§ 71.28 HERMITAGE AT MAIN STREET CONDOMINIUM
   (A) Parking.
      (1) All vehicles must park in designated areas and between the lines
provided.
      (2)   No person shall stop or stand a vehicle upon any streets or parts
of streets described as follows: all roads, both sides, for the entire length.
      (3) Handicapped Parking. All stalls shall be 12 foot wide as shown on the
attached site plan and will be marked with signage pursuant to R.7-8 and R.7-8P
(Reserved Parking Sign and Penalty Plate), in the designated parking areas for
persons who have been issued the Handicapped Parking Permit by the Division of
Motor Vehicles.
   (B)   Through streets. The following streets or parts of streets are hereby
designated as through streets. Stop signs shall be installed on the near right
side of each street intersection the through street, except where yield signs
are provided for in the designation.
      (1)   Hermitage Drive, entire length.
   (C)   Speed limits.
      (1)   The speed limit for both directions of travel on Hermitage Drive
shall be 20 miles per hour, entire length.
      (2)   The speed limit for both directions of travel on Main Street shall
be 20 miles per hour, entire length.
      (3)   Regulatory and warning signs shall be erected and maintained to
effect the above designated speed limits authorized by the Department of
Transportation.
   (D)   Tow away zone. Any vehicle parked or standing so as to obstruct or
impede the normal flow of traffic, block entrances or exitways, loading zones,
oil fills, any grassy area, pedestrian walkway, or present in any way a safety
or traffic hazard may be removed by towing the vehicle at the owner's or
operator's expense.
   (E)   Mid-block crosswalks. The following locations are hereby designated as
mid-block crosswalks:
      (1) Hermitage Drive, as indicated on site plan;
      (2) Main Street, as indicated on site plan.
   (F)   Installation of signs. All signs, posts or other necessary materials
shall be installed and paid for by the applicant. All signage shall conform to
the current manual on Uniform Traffic Control Devices, pursuant to N.J.S.A. 39:
4-198 and N.J.S.A. 39:4-183.27.
   (G)   Violations and penalties. Unless another penalty is expressly provided
by state statute, every person convicted of a violation of this section or any
supplement thereto shall be subject to a penalty as provided in §
70.99. For violations for which no penalty has previously been prescribed, the
penalty shall not be more than $50 or imprisonment for a term not to exceed 15
days, or both.
(Ord. 921-99, passed 4-12-99)
Editor's note:
   The Hermitage at Main Street Condominium site plan is on file in the
Township Clerk's office.

operator's expense.
   (E)   Installation of signs. All signs, posts or other necessary materials
shall be installed and paid for by the applicant. All signage shall conform to
the current manual on Uniform Traffic Control Devices, pursuant to N.J.S.A. 39:
4-198 and N.J.S.A. 39:4-183.27.
   (F)   Violations and penalties. Unless another penalty is expressly provided
by state statute, every person convicted of a violation of this section or any
supplement thereto shall be subject to a penalty as provided in §
70.99. For violations for which no penalty has previously been prescribed, the
penalty shall not be more than $50 or imprisonment for a term not to exceed 15
days, or both.
(Ord. 922-99, passed 4-12-99)
Editor's note:
   The Chelsea Place Apartments site plan is on file in the Township Clerk's
office.
§ 71.30 THE CLUB AT MAIN STREET APARTMENTS.
   (A)   Parking.
      (1)   All vehicles must park in designated areas and between the lines
provided.
      (2)   No person shall stop or stand a vehicle upon any streets or parts
of streets described as follows: all roads, both sides, entire length.
      (3)   Handicapped parking. All stalls shall be 12 foot wide as shown on
the attached site plan and will be marked with signage pursuant to R. 7-8 and
R. 7-8P (Reserved Parking Sign and Penalty Plate), in the designated parking
areas for persons who have been issued the Handicapped Parking Permit by the
Division of Motor Vehicles.
   (B)   Through streets. The following streets or parts of streets are hereby
designated as Through Streets. Stop signs shall be installed on the near right
side of each street intersection the through street, except where yield signs
are provided for in the designation: Hermitage Drive, for the entire length.
   (C)   Speed limits.
      (1)   The speed limit for both directions of travel on Hermitage Drive
shall be 20 miles per hour, entire length.
      (2)   The speed limit for both directions of travel on Berwyn Court shall
be 15 miles per hour, entire length.
      (3)   The speed limit for both directions of travel on Avalon Court shall
be 15 miles per hour, entire length.
      (4)   Regulatory and warning signs shall be erected and maintained to
effect the above designated speed limits authorized by the Department of
Transportation.
   (D)   Tow away zone. Any vehicle parked or standing so as to obstruct or
impede the normal flow of traffic, block entrances or exitways, loading zones,
oil fills, any grassy area, pedestrian walkway, or present in any way a safety
or traffic hazard may be removed by towing the vehicle at the owner's or
operator's expense.
   (E)   Mid-block crosswalks. The following locations are hereby designated as
mid-block crosswalks:
      (1)   Hermitage Drive, as indicated on site plan.
      (2)   Berwyn Court, as indicated on site plan.
      (3)   Avalon Court, as indicated on site plan.
   (F)   Installation of signs. All signs, posts or other necessary materials
shall be installed and paid for by the applicant. All signage shall conform to
the current manual on Uniform Traffic Control Devices, pursuant to N.J.S.A. 39:
4-198 and N.J.S.A. 39:4-183.27.
   (G)   Violations and penalties. Unless another penalty is expressly provided
by state statute, every person convicted of a violation of this section or any
supplement thereto shall be subject to a penalty as provided in §
70.99. For violations for which no penalty has previously been prescribed, the
penalty shall not be more than $50 or imprisonment for a term not to exceed 15
days, or both.
(Ord. 923-99, passed 4-12-99)
Editor's note:
   The Club at Main Street Apartments site plan is on file in the Township
Clerk's office.
§ 71.31 ECHELON I AND ECHELON II.
   (A)   Parking.
      (1)   All vehicles must park in designated areas and between the lines
provided.
      (2)   No person shall stop or stand a vehicle upon any of the streets or
parts of streets described as follows: Roads "A" and "B", both sides, for the
entire length.
      (3)   Handicapped parking. All stalls shall be 12 foot wide as shown on
the attached site plan, and will be marked with signage pursuant to R.7-8 and
R.7-8P (Reserved Parking Sign and Penalty Plate), in the designated parking
areas for persons who have been issued the Handicapped Parking Permit by the
Division of Motor Vehicles.
   (B)   Stop intersections. The intersections described below are hereby
designated as stop intersections. Stop signs shall be installed as provided in
subsection (E).
      (1)   Laurel Road and Road A; stop sign on Road A.
      (2)   Road A and Road B; stop sign on Road B.
   (C)   Speed limits.
      (1)   The speed limit for both directions of traffic for the parking lot
areas shall be 15 miles per hour.
      (2)   The speed limit for both directions of travel on all roadways shall
be 15 miles per hour over the entire length of such roadways.
      (3)   Regulatory and warning signs shall be erected and maintained to
effect the above designated speed limits authorized by the Department of
Transportation.
   (D)   Tow away zone. Any vehicle parked or standing so as to obstruct or
impede the normal flow of traffic, block entrances or exitways, loading zones,
oil fills, any grassy area, pedestrian walkway, or present in any way a safety
or traffic hazard may be removed by towing the vehicle at the owner's or
operator's expense.
   (E)   Installation of signs. All signs, posts or other necessary materials
shall be installed and paid for by the applicant. All signage shall conform to
the current manual on Uniform Traffic Control Devices, pursuant to N.J.S.A. 39:
4-198 and N.J.S.A. 39:4-183.27.
   (F)   Violations and penalties. Unless another penalty is expressly provided
by state statute, every person convicted of a violation of this section or any
supplement thereto shall be subject to a penalty as provided in §
70.99. For violations for which no penalty has previously been prescribed, the
penalty shall not be more than $50 or imprisonment for a term not to exceed 15
days, or both.
(Ord. 924-99, passed 4-12-99)
Editor's note:
   The Echelon I and Echelon II site plan is on file in the Township Clerk's
office.
§ 71.32 EVESHAM BUILDING ASSOCIATES.
   (A)   Parking.
      (1)   All vehicles must park in designated areas and between the lines
provided.
      (2)   No person shall stop or stand a vehicle upon any of the streets or
parts of streets described as follows: all roads, both sides, at all hours, for
the entire length.
      (3)   Handicapped parking. All stalls shall be 12 foot wide as shown on
the attached site plan and will be marked with signage pursuant to R.7-8 and
R.7-8P (Reserved Parking Sign and Penalty Plate), in the designated parking
areas for persons who have been issued the Handicapped Parking Permit by the
Division of Motor Vehicles.
      (4)   Reserved parking. All vehicles that are granted special parking in
the reserved parking spaces as shown on the attached site plan, including, but
not limited to, police vehicles, ambulances and teachers, must be properly
identified.
   (B)   Through streets and stop intersections.
      (1)   Through streets. The following streets or parts of streets are
hereby designated as through streets. Stop signs shall be installed on the near
right side of each street intersecting the through street, except where yield
signs are provided for in the designations: Road "A", for the entire length.
      (2)   Stop intersections. The intersections described below are hereby
designated as stop intersections. Stop signs shall be installed as provided
herein.
      (1)   Cooper Road and Road A, stop sign on Road A.
      (2)   Road B and Aisle C, stop sign on Road B.
   (C)   One-way streets. The following described streets or parts of streets
are hereby designated as one-way streets in the direction indicated: Road "B",
heading west, for the entire length.
   (D)   Speed limits.
      (1)   The speed limit for both directions of traffic for the parking lot
areas shall be 15 miles per hour.
      (2)   The speed limit for both directions of travel on all roadways shall
be 15 miles per hour over the entire length of such roadways.
      (3)   Regulatory and warning signs shall be erected and maintained to
effect the above designated speed limits authorized by the Department of
Transportation.
   (E)   Tow away zone. Any vehicle parked or standing so as to obstruct or
impede the normal flow of traffic, block entrances or exitways, loading zones,
oil fills, any grassy area, pedestrian walkway, or present in any way a safety
or traffic hazard may be removed by towing the vehicle at the owner's or
operator's expense.
   (F)   Turn prohibitions. No person shall make a turn at any location listed
below and only in the manner described: at the intersection of Clements Bridge-
Evesham Road (C.R. 544) and Road "A", no left turn from northbound on Road "A"
to westbound on Clements Bridge-Evesham Road (C.R. 544).
   (G)   Loading zones. The locations described below are hereby designated as
loading zones. No person shall park a vehicle in a designated loading zone
during the times indicated other than for the purpose of loading and unloading
of goods and materials:
      (1)   Road "B", at all times, on the north side, as indicated on the site
plan.
      (2)   Aisle "A", at all times, on the west side, as indicated on the site
plan.
   (H)   Installation of signs. All signs, posts or other necessary materials
shall be installed and paid for by the applicant. All signage shall conform to
the current manual on Uniform Traffic Control Devices, pursuant to N.J.S.A. 39:
4-198 and N.J.S.A. 39:4-183.27.
   (I)   Violations and penalties. Unless another penalty is expressly provided
by state statute, every person convicted of a violation of this section or any
supplement thereto shall be subject to a penalty as provided in §
70.99. For violations for which no penalty has previously been prescribed, the
penalty shall not be more than $50 or imprisonment for a term not to exceed 15
days, or both.
(Ord. 936-99, passed 7-12-99)
Editor's note:
   The Evesham Building Associates site plan is on file in the Township Clerk's
office.
§ 71.33 BRITTON PLACE CONDOMINIUM.
   (A)   Parking.
      (1)   All vehicles must park in designated areas and between the lines

      (2)   No person shall stop or stand a vehicle upon any of the streets or

   (B)   Stop intersections. The intersections described below are hereby
designated as stop intersections. Stop signs shall be installed as provided in
division (E): Lucas Lane and Road A, stop sign on Road A.
   (C)   Speed limits.
      (1)   The speed limit for both directions of travel on the following
roadways shall be as follows: Road "A", the entire length, 15 miles per hour.
      (2)   Regulatory and warning signs shall be erected and maintained to
effect the above designated speed limits authorized by the Department of
Transportation.
   (D)   Tow away zone. Any vehicle parked or standing so as to obstruct or
impede the normal flow of traffic, block entrances or exitways, loading zones,
oil fills, any grassy area, pedestrian walkway, or present in any way a safety
or traffic hazard may be removed by towing the vehicle at the owner's or

4-198 and N.J.S.A. 39:4-183.27.
   (F) Violations and penalties. Unless another penalty is expressly provided

supplement thereto shall be subject to a penalty as provided in §
70.99. For violations for which no penalty has previously been prescribed, the
penalty shall not be more than $50 or imprisonment for a term not to exceed 15
days, or both.

§ 71.35 2401 EVESHAM ROAD.
   (A)   General parking.
      (1)   All vehicles must park in designated areas and between the lines
provided.
      (2)   No person shall park a vehicle for longer than the time limit upon
any of the streets or parts of streets described below.
 
Name of Street Sides Hours Location
Access drive   Both  All   From Cooper Road (CR 675) to Evesham Road (CR 544)
Drive aisles   Both  All   Entire Site
(Unless in designated spaces)
 
      (3)   Handicapped parking. All van accessible stalls shall be eight feet
wide with an eight- foot loading area, and standard handicapped parking stalls
shall be eight feet wide with a five-foot loading area as shown on the site
plan attached to Ord. 171-10, and signed with R7-8 and R7-8P (Reserved Parking
with Penalty Plate), in the designated parking areas for persons who have been
issued the handicapped parking permit by the Division of Motor Vehicles.
   (B)   Through streets, stop and yield intersections.
      (1)   Through streets. No through traffic is permitted between Cooper
Road (CR 675) and Evesham Road (CR 544) for any other purpose than to utilize
or patronize any facilities on the site. No person shall drive a motor vehicle
through the property for the purpose of avoiding a traffic signal or sign on
the public roadways.
      (2)   Stop intersections. The following described intersections are
hereby designated as stop intersections. Stop signs shall be installed as
provided therein.
 
Intersection                            Stop Signs on
Access Drive and Cooper Road (CR 675)   Access Drive
Access Drive and Evesham Road (CR 544)  Access Drive
Access Drive and internal drive aisles  Internal drive aisles
Front drive aisle and side parking lots Front drive aisle
 
   (C)   Speed limits.
      (1)   The speed limit for both directions of traffic in the parking
aisles shall be 25 mph.
      (2)   The advisory speed limit for the speed hump is 15 mph.
   (D)   Tow-away zones. Any vehicle parked or standing as to obstruct or
impede a normal flow of traffic, block entrances or exit ways, loading zones,
oil fills, any grassy area, pedestrian walkway, or present in any way a safety
or traffic hazard, may be removed by towing the vehicle at the owner’s or
operator’s expense.
   (E)   No passing zones. All streets or parts of streets shall be designated
as no passing zones.
(Ord. 171-10, passed 10-10-10)
§ 71.36 113 NJSH ROUTE 73.
   (A)   General parking.
      (1)   All vehicles must park in designated areas and between the lines
provided.
      (2)   No person shall park a vehicle for longer than the time limit upon
any of the streets or parts of streets described below.
 
Name of Street                Sides Hours Location
Access Drive and Drive Aisles Both  All   Entire Site
(Unless in Designated Spaces)
      (3)   Handicapped parking. All van accessible stalls shall be 11-feet
wide, with a five-foot loading area and standard handicapped parking stalls
shall be eight-feet wide with a five-foot loading area as shown on the attached
site plan and signed with R7-8 and R7-8P (Reserved Parking with Penalty Plate),
in the designated parking areas for persons who have been issued the
handicapped parking permit by the Division of Motor Vehicles.
   (B)   Through streets, stop and yield intersections.
      (1)   Through streets. No through traffic is permitted between New Jersey
State Highway Route 73 and Lakeside Avenue for any other purpose than to
utilize or patronize any facilities on the side. No person shall drive a motor
vehicle through the property for the purpose of avoiding a traffic signal or
sign on the public roadways.
      (2)   Stop intersections. The following described intersections are
hereby designated as stop intersections. Stop signs shall be installed as
provided therein.
 
Intersection                       Stop Signs on:
Access Drive and NJSH Route 73     Access Drive
Access Drive and Lakeside Avenue   Access Drive
Access Drive and Front Drive Aisle Front Drive Aisle
Access Drive and Rear Drive Aisle  Access Drive
 
   (C)   Speed limits. The speed limit for both directions of traffic in the
parking aisle shall be 15 mph.
   (D)   Tow-away zones. Any vehicle parked or standing as to obstruct a normal
flow of traffic, block entrances or exit ways, loading/unloading zones,
pedestrian walkways, or present in any way a safety or traffic hazard may be
removed by towing the vehicle at the owners or operator’s expense.
   (E)   No passing zones. All streets or parts of streets shall be designated
as no passing zones.
(Ord. 242-13, passed 12-26-13)
§ 71.37 1031 VOORHEES DRIVE.
   (A)   General parking.
      (1)   All vehicles must park in designated areas and between the lines
provided.
      (2)   No person shall park a vehicle for longer than the time limit upon
any of the streets or parts of streets described below.
 
Name of Street                Sides Hours Location
Access Drive and Drive Aisles Both  All   Entire Site
(Unless in Designated Spaces)
      (3)   Handicapped parking. All van accessible stalls shall be 11-feet

loading area and standard handicapped parking stalls shall be eight-feet wide
with a five-foot loading area as shown on the attached site plan and signed
with R7-8 and R7-8P (Reserved Parking with Penalty Plate), in the designated
parking areas for persons who have been issued the handicapped parking permit
by the Division of Motor Vehicles.
   (B)   Through streets, stop and yield intersections.
      (1)   Through streets. No through traffic is permitted between Executive
Drive and Voorhees Drive for any other purpose than to utilize or patronize any
facilities on the site. No person shall drive a motor vehicle through the
property for the purpose of avoiding a traffic signal or sign on the public
roadways.
      (2)   Stop intersections. The following described intersections are
hereby designated a stop intersections. Stop signs shall be installed as
provided therein.

   (C)   Speed limits. The speed limit for both directions of traffic in the

   (D)   Tow-away zones. Any vehicles parked or standing as to obstruct or

   (E)   No passing zones. All streets or parts of streets shall be designated

   (B)   (1)   Stop and yield intersections.

as no passing zones.

§ 71.40 FOSTER SQUARE APARTMENTS.
   (A)   General parking.
      (1)   All vehicles must park in designated areas and between the lines
provided.
      (2)   No person shall park a vehicle for longer than the time limit upon
any of the streets or parts of streets described below.
 
Name of Street                Sides Hours Location
Access Drive and Drive Aisles Both  All   Entire Site
(Unless in Designated Spaces)
 
      (3)   Handicapped parking. All van accessible stalls shall be 11 feet
wide, with a five-foot loading area (or eight feet wide, with an eight-foot
loading area) and standard handicapped parking stalls shall be eight feet wide
with a five-foot loading area as shown on the attached site plan and signed
with R7-8 and R7-8P (Reserved Parking with Penalty Plate), in the designated
parking areas for persons who have been issued the handicapped parking permit
by the Division of Motor Vehicles.
   (B)   Through streets, stop and yield intersections.
      (1)   Through streets. No through traffic is permitted on Abitaire
Boulevard for any other purpose than to utilize or patronize any facilities on
the site. No person shall drive a motor vehicle through the property for the
purpose of avoiding a traffic signal or sign on the public roadways.
      (2)   Stop intersections. The following described intersections are

§ 71.99 VALIDITY.
   If any part or parts of this chapter are held to be invalid by a court of
law for any reason, such decision shall not affect the validity or
enforceability of the remaining parts of this chapter.
(Ord. 963-99, passed 11-22-99)
CHAPTER 72: PARKING REGULATIONS
Section
   
72.01   Regulations not exclusive
   
72.02   Parking within lines
   
72.03   Tow-away zones
   
72.04   Emergency no parking
   
72.05   Handicapped parking
   
72.06   Fire zones
   
72.07   Temporary no parking zones
   
72.99   Penalty
§ 72.01 REGULATIONS NOT EXCLUSIVE.
   The provisions of this traffic code imposing a time limit on parking shall
not relieve any person of the duty to observe other and more restrictive
provisions prohibiting or limiting the stopping, standing or parking of
vehicles as set forth in N.J.S.A. 39:4-138, any other state statute or as
hereinafter provided.
('74 Code, § 122-5) (Ord. 28-1977, passed 3-14-77)
§ 72.02 PARKING WITHIN LINES.
   In any location in which there are designated parking areas, all vehicles
must park in the designated areas and between the lines indicating parking
spaces.
('74 Code, § 122-9.1) (Ord. 506-90, passed 7-23-90)
Penalty, see § 72.99
§ 72.03 TOW-AWAY ZONES.
   Any vehicle parked or standing as to obstruct or impede a normal flow of
traffic, block entrances or exitways, loading zones, oil fills, any grass area
or pedestrian walkway or present in any way a safety or traffic hazard may be
removed by towing the vehicle at the owner's or operator's expense.
('74 Code, § 122-9.2) (Ord. 506-90, passed 7-23-90)
Penalty, see § 72.99
§ 72.04 EMERGENCY NO PARKING.
   (A)   Designation of snow emergency no-parking areas.
      (1)   Whenever snow has fallen and the accumulation is such that it
covers the street or highway, no vehicle shall be parked on either side of any
of the streets or parts thereof described in Chapter 74 of this code.
      (2)   The above parking prohibitions shall remain in effect after the
snow has ceased until the streets have been plowed sufficiently and to the
extent that parking will not interfere with the normal flow of traffic.
('74 Code, § 122-22)
   (B)   Posting of signs.
      (1)   Upon the declaration of an emergency, there shall be no parking
upon streets or sections of streets where temporary emergency no-parking signs
are displayed. The Chief of Police or, in his absence, the ranking police
officer is authorized to declare an emergency and to direct the posting of the
emergency no-parking signs when weather conditions, accidents, fires or public
celebrations dictate or require the avoidance of hazards or other conditions
which interfere with the free flow of traffic.
      (2)   Notification that the emergency no-parking signs are being or will
be posted shall be given to the operator or owner of any vehicle which has been
parked prior to the posting of the signs.
('74 Code, § 122-23)
   (C)   Removal of vehicles. Any unoccupied vehicle parked or standing in
violation of this section shall be deemed a nuisance and a menace to the safe
and proper regulation of traffic, and any peace officer may provide for the
removal of such vehicle. The owner shall pay the reasonable costs of the
removal and storage which may result from such removal, before regaining
possession of the vehicle.
('74 Code, § 122-24)
   (D)   Effectiveness of section. The effectiveness of this section is
contingent on signs being erected as required by law.
('74 Code, § 122-25)
(Ord. 28-1977, passed 3-14-77)
Penalty, see § 72.99
§ 72.05 HANDICAPPED PARKING.
   (A)   Purpose. The purpose of this section is to establish certain areas
that are private property which are open to the public or to which the public
is invited, which shall be designated as handicapped parking spaces for use by
persons who have been issued special identification cards by the Division of
Motor Vehicles. No other person shall be permitted to park in these spaces.
('74 Code, § 122-30.1)
   (B)   Legislative authority. This section is enacted in accordance with
N.J.S.A. 39:4-197.5 and 40:48-2.46, which does confer upon the Township the
right to establish handicapped parking spaces in order to preserve and
safeguard the public health, safety, morals and welfare.
('74 Code, § 122-30.2)
   (C)   Designation of areas; signs. The areas listed in Chapter 74 of this
code shall be designated as handicapped parking spaces for use by persons who
have been issued special identification cards by the Division of Motor
Vehicles. No other persons shall be permitted to park in these spaces. The
spaces shall be marked by signs indicating the handicapped parking spaces in
conformance with the Manual on Uniform Traffic Control Devices for Streets and
Highways, most recent edition, on file with the New Jersey State Department of
Transportation, as may be amended from time to time.
('74 Code, § 122-30.3)
   (D)   Record of locations. The locations listed in
Chapter 74 of this code have been required to provide for parking spaces
designated as handicapped parking spaces, which spaces shall be marked by signs
indicating “Handicapped Parking Spaces.” The Chief of Police is hereby
empowered to maintain a record of locations requiring handicapped parking
spaces, to which record additional locations may be added as approved by the
Planning Board.
('74 Code, § 122-30.4)
(Ord. 356-1987, passed 2-23-87)
   (E)   Failure to exhibit placard. The handicapped permit or placard shall be
readily visible at all times within any motor vehicle parking in the areas
listed in
Chapter 74 of this code.
('74 Code, § 122-30.5.1) (Ord. 755-96, passed 2-26-96)
Penalty, see § 72.99
§ 72.06 FIRE ZONES.
   (A)   Purpose. The purpose of this section is to establish certain areas
that are private property which are open to the public or to which the public
is invited as “Parking Fire Zones.” No person shall be permitted to park in
these zones. This is to provide for the access of fire and other emergency
response equipment to these areas to safeguard the public safety and welfare.
('74 Code, § 122-30.6)
   (B)   Statutory authority. This section is enacted in accordance with
N.J.S.A. 40:48-2.46.
('74 Code, § 122-30.7)
   (C)   Designation. Fire zones shall be established on all properties listed
and identified in Chapter 74, Schedule V, which fire zones shall be marked by
signs indicating “No Parking Fire Zone.” Such zones shall be in conformance
with the Manual on Uniform Traffic Control Devices for Streets and Highways,
adopted March 20, 1973, and filed with the State Department of Transportation
on March 21, 1973. The owners of such properties shall be responsible for the
installation, maintenance and upkeep of any and all such signs and devices
called for in this section.
('74 Code, § 122-30.8)
   (D)   Records to be kept. The Police Department is hereby empowered and
directed to maintain a record of fire zone locations, to which record
additional locations may be added as approved by the Planning Board.
('74 Code, § 122-30.9)
   (E)   Parking prohibited. No person shall park a vehicle at any time in or
upon any of the fire zones or parts thereof as described in Chapter 74,
Schedule V.
('74 Code, § 122-30.10)
   (F)   Exceptions. Nothing in this section shall prevent an authorized
emergency vehicle from parking in these fire zones while on official business
or enforcing the provisions of this section.
('74 Code, § 122-30.11)
(Ord. 485-1990, passed 2-26-90)
Penalty, see § 72.99
§ 72.07 TEMPORARY NO PARKING ZONES.
   (A)   Upon the determination of the Township Police Department (the
Department) that weather conditions, accidents, fires, police emergencies or
public or private celebrations dictate or require avoidance of hazards or other
conditions which interfere with the free flow of traffic, the Department is
hereby authorized to establish temporary no parking on any Township street or
sections of streets affected thereby. Notification that such no parking zones
are being established shall be given to the operator or owner of any vehicle
parked in such areas prior to the establishment of such zones. Temporary no
parking zones shall be designated by the posting of signs clearly indicating
the temporary no parking of vehicles and the area or areas covered by the
temporary parking restrictions, as required by state and local law.
   (B)   Any unoccupied vehicle parked or standing in violation of the
temporary no parking established by the Department shall be deemed a nuisance
and a menace to the safe and proper regulation of traffic and any police
officer may provide for the removal of such vehicle. The owner of any vehicle
removed pursuant to this ordinance shall pay the reasonable costs of the
removal and storage of such vehicle that results from such removal before
regaining possession of the vehicle.
(Ord. 833-97, passed 9-8-97)
Penalty, see § 72.99
§ 72.99 PENALTY.
   (A)   Whoever violates any provision of this chapter for which no specific
penalty is otherwise provided shall be subject to the provisions of §
70.99.
   (B)   Unless another penalty is expressly provided by state statute, every
person convicted of a violation of §
72.05(A) through (D) shall be liable to a fine of not more than $100 for the
first violation and $100 for each additional violation, plus court costs.
('74 Code, § 122-30.5) (Ord. 356-1987, passed 2-23-87; Am. Ord. 630-1992,
passed 12-30-92)
   (C)   Unless another penalty is expressly provided by state statute, every
person convicted of a violation of §
72.05(E) shall be liable to a fine of not more than $25. If a person charged
with a violation of this section can exhibit his/her handicapped permit or
placard to the judge of the municipal court before whom he/she is summoned to
answer to the charge, such judge may dismiss the charge. However, the judge may
impose court costs.
('74 Code, § 122-30.5.1) (Ord. 755-96, passed 2-26-96)
   (D)   Unless another penalty is expressly provided by state statute, every
person convicted of a violation of a provision of §
72.06 or Ch. 75, Sch. V will be liable to a penalty of not more than $25.
('74 Code, § 122-30.12) (Ord. 485-1990, passed 2-26-90)
   (E)   Unless another penalty is expressly provided by state statute, every
person convicted of a violation of a provision of §
72.07 will be liable to a penalty of not more than $100 or imprisonment for a
term not exceeding 15 days, or both.
(Ord. 833-97, passed 9-8-97)
CHAPTER 73: PROHIBITED OPERATION OF VEHICLES
Section
   
73.01   Definitions
   
73.02   Operation on Township-owned land
   
73.03   Operation on private property
   
73.04   Noise
   
73.05   Reckless operation
   
73.06   Use for public work
   
73.07   Parental responsibility
   
73.08   Validity
   
73.99   Penalty
§ 73.01 DEFINITIONS.
   For the purpose of this chapter, the following definition shall apply unless
the context clearly indicates or requires a different meaning.
   TOWNSHIP-OWNED LAND.  All parks, recreation areas, ball parks, lake areas,
storage facilities, garage areas, Board of Education property and any and all
other Township or publicly owned land and premises, excluding public streets,
sidewalks and other areas dedicated or commonly used for vehicular or
pedestrian traffic.
('74 Code, § 124-1) (Ord. 1971-18, passed 12-14-71)
§ 73.02 OPERATION ON TOWNSHIP-OWNED LAND.
   It shall be unlawful for any person to operate any type of motor-driven
vehicle or conveyance, including but not necessarily limited to snowmobiles,
two-wheel motor vehicles known as mini-bicycles, trail bicycles, motor scooters
and four-wheel motor vehicles, commonly known as go-carts, dune buggies or
quads, upon any Township-owned land in the Township. This prohibition, however,
shall not apply to licensed motor-driven vehicles operated on designated
driveways and parking areas within such Township-owned land.
('74 Code, § 124-2) (Ord. 1971-18, passed 12-14-71)
Penalty, see § 73.99
§ 73.03 OPERATION ON PRIVATE PROPERTY.
   (A)   The operation of a motor-driven vehicle as defined in §
73.02 of this chapter is additionally prohibited upon private property, unless
the operator of the motor-driven vehicle is the owner of the property or has in
such person's possession the expressed written permission to operate the
vehicle on the private property by the owner of the property.
('74 Code, § 124-3) (Ord. 1971-18, passed 12-14-71)
Penalty, see § 73.99
§ 73.04 NOISE.
   It shall be unlawful to operate any motor-driven vehicle as defined in §
73.02 in a manner so as to create loud, unnecessary or unusual noise so as to
disturb or interfere with the peace and quiet of other persons.
('74 Code, § 124-4) (Ord. 1971-18, passed 12-14-71)
Penalty, see § 73.99
§ 73.05 RECKLESS OPERATION.
   It shall be unlawful to operator any motor-driven vehicle as defined in §
73.02 in a careless, reckless or negligent manner so as to endanger the safety
of any person or the property of any person.
('74 Code, § 124-5) (Ord. 1971-18, passed 12-14-71)
Penalty, see § 73.99
§ 73.06 USE FOR PUBLIC WORK.
   It shall not be unlawful for any employee of this Township to operate motor-
driven vehicles as defined in §
73.02 for the purpose of maintenance, repairing or doing any public work within
the scope of his employment.
('74 Code, § 124-6) (Ord. 1971-18, passed 12-14-71)
§ 73.07 PARENTAL RESPONSIBILITY.
   It shall be unlawful for the parent, guardian or any person having the care,
custody and control of any child under the age of 17 years to permit such child
to operate a motor driven vehicle, as defined in §
73.02, in violation of the terms of this chapter.
('74 Code, § 124-7) (Ord. 1971-18, passed 12-14-71)
Penalty, see § 73.99
§ 73.08 VALIDITY.
   If any part or parts of this chapter are held to be invalid by a court of
law for any reason, such decision shall not affect the validity or
enforceability of the remaining parts of this chapter.
(Ord. 963-99, passed 11-22-99)
§ 73.99 PENALTY.
   Any child operator or parent, as defined in this chapter, who shall violate
any of the provisions of this chapter shall, upon conviction thereof, be
sentenced to a fine not exceeding $500 or to imprisonment for any term not
exceeding 90 days, or both.
('74 Code, § 124-8) (Ord. 1971-18, passed 12-14-71)

XIII.   Overweight trucks excluded

   Pursuant to the provisions of N.J.S.A. 39:4-140, the streets or parts of
streets described in this schedule are hereby designated as through streets.

intersecting the through street, except where yield signs are provided for in
the designations.

SCHEDULE XIII. OVERWEIGHT TRUCKS EXCLUDED.
   Trucks over four tons gross weight are hereby excluded from the streets or
parts of streets described in this schedule, except for the pickup and delivery
of materials on such streets.
